Blaming TPB for it sounds all to easy, doesn't it? Piracy is one thing......

pricing policy, upgrading, etc another .........

While airman123 continues to spread his love for PSS (probably because he worked there), he has failed to do so with facts. It is not the torrent sharing system that has cost PSS. After all, the only money PSS could possibly lose from torrents is from those who would have purchased the product had sites like this not been available. I highly doubt that there are enough people who would have otherwise purchased this product legitimately that would make any notable difference in sales. Also, airman123 (aka PSS) has failed to note that PSS products are generally pathetic, with inaccurate and poorly designed systems management. And finally, the prices at PSS would have you believe that there products are on par with quality flight simulator products, such as those from PMDG, Level-D, Flight 1 and others. This is far from reality. The LDS 767 is miles beyond any PSS aircraft and cheaper than most. In closing, airman123 (PSS) should consider all of this before he re-opens the site. Perhaps with some proper planning you will manage not to fail miserably next time, though I'm sure you will.
